meanings.definition: A person who is perceived as being sad or pathetic.
meanings.sent1: The poor saddo always looks so downcast.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a saddo, cheer up and smile!
meanings.sent3: The little dog felt like a saddo with its droopy ears.
meanings.sent4: Her wilted flowers in the vase were like a bunch of saddos.
meanings.sent5: The image of the lonely tree in the field was a true saddo.

meanings.definition: A person who is socially awkward or lacking in social skills.
meanings.sent1: The new student felt like a saddo at the lunch table.
meanings.sent2: He's a bit of a saddo when it comes to making conversation.
meanings.sent3: The robot at the party was the ultimate saddo guest.
meanings.sent4: His attempts at jokes were like a saddo trying to dance.
meanings.sent5: The awkward penguin waddled around like a true saddo.
